Source: The use of field–based social information in eusocial foragers: local enhancement among nestmates and heterospecifics in stingless bees
The use of field–based social information in eusocial foragers: local enhancement among nestmates and heterospecifics in stingless bees

Nesting: "This species builds exposed nests made of hard mud in rock crevices, more rarely on twigs"
Constructs aboveground nests of sand shaped into a ball and attached to twigs or rocks
Hole, also excavastes burrows in crumbling or soft mortar
